sub_topic: Probability of a certain weather event occurring
message_1: A weather forecasting agency predicts that the probability of a thunderstorm in a city is 0.35. What is the probability that there will be no thunderstorm in the city?
message_2:
The probability of an event not happening is equal to 1 minus the probability of the event happening. In this case, the probability of no thunderstorm is:

1 - P(thunderstorm) = 1 - 0.35 = 0.65

So, the probability that there will be no thunderstorm in the city is 0.65 or 65%.
